author: alx9r
body:
I've been reviewing #4568 and related issues trying to understand the design intent of the differences between `$VerbosePreference` and `-Verbose`, but I'm coming up short.  `Import-Module` seems to pass `$VerbosePreference` to the module scriptblock, but the value of the `-Verbose` parameter does not pass through.  On the other hand, the value of `-Verbose` passes through to a function defined in the module when it is called.

1.  Should the value of `-Verbose` passed to `Import-Module` be reflected by `$VerbosePreference` when the module's scriptblock is executed?
2. If not, what is the reasoning behind this?
3. Is there any way to access the value of `-Verbose` from within the scriptblock imported by `Import-Module`?

# Steps to reproduce

```powershell
#m.psm1 
$args[0].vp = $VerbosePreference           # "ModulePref"
function ModuleFunction {
    [CmdletBinding()]
    param()
    [pscustomobject]@{
        vp = $VerbosePreference            # "FuncPref","FuncPrefNoArg"
        v  = $PSCmdlet.
                MyInvocation.
                BoundParameters['Verbose'] # "FuncArg"
    }
}
```

```powershell
@(
    @{ vp='Continue'         ; v=$true  }
    @{ vp='Continue'         ; v=$false }
    @{ vp='SilentlyContinue' ; v=$true  }
    @{ vp='SilentlyContinue' ; v=$false }
) |
    . {
        process {
        $h= @{}
        $VerbosePreference = $_.vp          # "CallerPref"
        Import-Module $PSScriptRoot\m.psm1 -Force `
                      -args $h `
                      -Verbose:$_.v         # "CallerArg"

        $mf = ModuleFunction -Verbose:$_.v  # "CallerArg"
        [pscustomobject]@{
            CallerPref    = $_.vp
            CallerArg     = $_.v
            ModulePref    = $h.vp
            FuncPref      = $mf.vp
            FuncArg       = $mf.v
            FuncPrefNoArg = ModuleFunction | % vp
        }
    }} | ft
```

# Expected behavior

Note the difference in the "ModulePref" column.

```none
CallerPref       CallerArg       ModulePref         FuncPref FuncArg    FuncPrefNoArg
----------       ---------       ----------         -------- -------    -------------
Continue              True         Continue         Continue True            Continue
Continue             False SilentlyContinue SilentlyContinue False           Continue
SilentlyContinue      True         Continue         Continue True    SilentlyContinue
SilentlyContinue     False SilentlyContinue SilentlyContinue False   SilentlyContinue
```

# Actual behavior

```none
CallerPref       CallerArg       ModulePref         FuncPref FuncArg    FuncPrefNoArg
----------       ---------       ----------         -------- -------    -------------
Continue              True         Continue         Continue True            Continue
Continue             False         Continue SilentlyContinue False           Continue
SilentlyContinue      True SilentlyContinue         Continue True    SilentlyContinue
SilentlyContinue     False SilentlyContinue SilentlyContinue False   SilentlyContinue
```

comments.body: It also has different behavior if you use `-Force` or not. If you use `-Force`, it will ignore `-Verbose` setting.

title: Why is Import-Module transparent to $VerbosePreference but not -Verbose?
